intro: Aulosepalum riodelayense, commonly known as the Rio Delayense fern, is a rare and endemic species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lace-like fronds that exhibit a unique pattern of lobes and serrations. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, including spore-producing sorus, are positioned along the margins of the fronds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
